metadata.title: CVE-2025-23084 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Node.js, specifically affecting thehandling of drive names in the Windows environment. Certain Node.jsfunctions do not treat drive names as special on Windows. As a result,although Node.js assumes a relative path, it actually refers to the rootdirectory.On Windows, a path that does not start with the file separator is treatedas relative to the current directory.This vulnerability affects Windows users of `path.join` API.

criterions.comment: nodejs package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
